<properties pageTitle="ada30f94-b155-4441-a53a-0f8ce1f9baba" description="38fd4007-d23d-492a-97ec-6714d44efaad" editor="cgronlun" manager="paulettm" services="hdinsight" documentationCenter="" tags="azure-portal" authors="mumian"/>

LinkItem.internal_link_text: Use MapReduce with Hadoop on HDInsight with SSH
Use MapReduce with Hadoop on HDInsight using Curl
Use MapReduce with Hadoop on HDInsight with SSH
Use MapReduce with Hadoop on HDInsight using Curl

MarkdownCodeBlock.code_block: $subscriptionName = "<SubscriptionName>" # Azure subscription name $clusterName = "<ClusterName>" # HDInsight cluster name

# Submit the job Select-AzureSubscription $subscriptionName $wordCountJob = Start-AzureHDInsightJob -Cluster $clusterName -JobDefinition $wordCountJobDefinition | Wait-AzureHDInsightJob -WaitTimeoutInSeconds 3600

$subscriptionName = "<SubscriptionName>" # Azure subscription name $storageAccountName = "<StorageAccountName>" # Azure storage account name $containerName = "<ContainerName>" # Blob storage container name

# Select the current subscription Select-AzureSubscription $subscriptionName
# Create the storage account context object $storageAccountKey = Get-AzureStorageKey $storageAccountName | %{ $_.Primary } $storageContext = New-AzureStorageContext -StorageAccountName $storageAccountName -StorageAccountKey $storageAccountKey
# Download the job output to the workstation Get-AzureStorageBlobContent -Container $ContainerName -Blob example/data/WordCountOutput/part-r-00000 -Context $storageContext -Force

ImageItem.internal_link_text: Word frequency results in PowerShell from the Hadoop MapReduce word count example in HDInsight.
Word frequency results in PowerShell from the Hadoop MapReduce word count example in HDInsight.
